==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|ふ|せい|k2=ぜい|yomi=on}}
Probably from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ふぜい}} compound {{m|ltc|風情|tr=*biung *d͡zjeŋ}}. Compare modern {{etyl|zh|-}} traditional {{m|zh|風情}} and simplified {{m|zh|风情|tr=fēngqíng}}.

The reading uses the older [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']] of ''fu'' for {{ja-l|風}} and the newer [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']] of ''sei'' for {{ja-l|情}}, suggesting either that this term underwent changes after importation into Japanese, or that it may have been re-imported.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|a|ふ|ぜい}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{ja-accent-common|h|ふ|ぜい}}<ref name="DJR"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɸɯᵝze̞ː]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ふぜい}}

# [[taste]], [[elegance]]
# [[discernment]], [[sophistication]]
# [[appearance]], outward [[attitude]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=ふぜい|theater|noh}} in [[noh]] theater, an actor's [[bearing]], [[carriage]], and [[gesture]]s: [[body language]]

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|ふぜい}}

# [[similar]] to, [[like]], [[type]] or [[kind]] of thing
# {{lb|ja|sort=ふぜい|pejorative}} the likes of ... {{qualifier|particularly when appended to a person's name}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|ふう|じょう|yomi=on}}
The older [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']] reading for both characters, so probably the term as originally imported from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ふうじょう}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|ふ|うじょう}}<ref name="DJR"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɸɯᵝːd͡ʑʲo̞ː]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ふうじょう}}

# [[appearance]], outward [[attitude]]
